value.title: DAX Fridays! #35: VALUES
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays! video we will go through the DAX function VALUES. VALES will return a unique value when a table of multiple values is the result of your calculation. value.title: DAX Fridays! #44: CROSSFILTER
value.excerpt: IN todays video, we will go trough an example on how crossfilter works. Crossfilter can simulate relationships and active and deactivate them as you need to. It is very useful for solving issues with many to many relationships and performance issues.  Northwind dataset: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k3NMIlLffrU

value.title: DAX Fridays! #48: TIME (Calculate working hours)
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays we will learn how Power pivot or Power BI manages time using the TIME function. We will also create an example with the TIME function where we will calculate the working hours in a calendar. value.title: DAX Fridays! #79: KEEPFILTERS
value.excerpt: In today's video we are going through the DAX function KEEPFILTERS. KEEPFILTERS will remove the behaviour that CALCULATE has where it removes the filters available. value.title: DAX Fridays! #80: DATESBETWEEN
value.excerpt: In todays video we are going to cover the DAX function DATESBETWEEN.  DATESBETWEEN function allows you to calculate amounts between two dates you specify. value.title: Building a Virtual Relationship in Power BI   Basics of TREATAS DAX Function
value.excerpt: TreatAs is an interesting function with multiple use cases in Power BI. I thought it is good to explain it in a set of videos, the first one here is about what the TreatAs function is and how it can help to build filters and a virtual relationship between two tables. Let's see how you can use this function.
